title: Korean Named Entity Recognition Based on Language-Specific Features. (arXiv:2305.06330v1 [cs.CL])
abstract: In the paper, we propose a novel way of improving named entity recognition in the Korean language using its language-specific features. While the field of named entity recognition has been studied extensively in recent years, the mechanism of efficiently recognizing named entities in Korean has hardly been explored. This is because the Korean language has distinct linguistic properties that prevent models from achieving their best performances. Therefore, an annotation scheme for {Korean corpora} by adopting the CoNLL-U format, which decomposes Korean words into morphemes and reduces the ambiguity of named entities in the original segmentation that may contain functional morphemes such as postpositions and particles, is proposed herein. We investigate how the named entity tags are best represented in this morpheme-based scheme and implement an algorithm to convert word-based {and syllable-based Korean corpora} with named entities into the proposed morpheme-based format. tldr: 本文提出了一种基于语言特性的韩文命名实体识别方法，采用 CoNLL-U 格式注释方案将韩语单词分解为语素，并实现了一个算法，将基于单词和音节的韩国语料库转换为所提出的基于语素的格式，从而实现了准确地识别韩文命名实体。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a language-specific method for improved named entity recognition in Korean by adopting the CoNLL-U format annotation scheme to decompose Korean words into morphemes, reducing ambiguity in original segmentations, and implementing an algorithm to convert word and syllable-based corpora into the proposed morpheme-based format, ultimately achieving accurate recognition of Korean named entities.
